error.signature: Rendered more hooks than during the previous render
error.regex: Rendered more hooks than during the previous render

verdict.summary: Hooks called conditionally or in different order between renders. Violates Rules of Hooks.

dead_ends.action: Move the conditional inside the hook
dead_ends.why_fails: Some hooks don't support conditional logic internally

dead_ends.action: Use useRef to track which hooks to skip
dead_ends.why_fails: Over-engineering — just follow Rules of Hooks

workarounds.action: Hooks must be called in the same order every render — move conditionals INSIDE hooks, not around them
workarounds.how:
// Bad: if (cond) { useState(...) }
// Good: const [val] = useState(cond ? x : y)

workarounds.action: If a component conditionally needs a hook, split into two components
Check for early returns before hooks — all hooks must run before any return
workarounds.how: Check for early returns before hooks — all hooks must run before any return

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'Rendered more hooks than during the previous rende' is a hook_error error while 'Error' has a different failure mode despite similar symptoms. Check error message details to differentiate.
